list_definition.definition: the flesh of sheep, used as food

list_ex_of_english: I have difficulty deciding whether we have lamb, or mutton dressed up as lamb.
None of these artists enjoy a hearth, or leg of mutton, of one's own.
If the land were not used for growing timber, it would be producing mutton, wool and beef.
I should have thought that at least it would be easy enough to get a concession, if that is the word, on mutton and lamb.
Similarly, the weight of meat (mutton) varies between 5 and 8 percent of the overall budget.
The development of the mutton market is an indication of how marketing has developed.
Raising his eyes from his mutton, the owner may see inscribed upon his own horizon the acceptable difference between the rich and the poor.
I shall confine myself to speaking extremely briefly about milk, mutton and beef.
